intro: Pterocactus neuquensis, commonly known as the Neuquén pterocactus, is a species of cactus native to Argentina. It is characterized by its cylindrical stems that are often ribbed and covered with spines. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer seasons. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent structure. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
